017package org.apache.commons.chain.config;
018
019import org.apache.commons.digester.Digester;
020import org.apache.commons.digester.RuleSetBase;
021
022/**
023 * Digester {@code RuleSet} for configuring <em>Chain of
024 * Responsibility</em> command chains, and adding them to an appropriate
025 * {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog}. The following properties
026 * may be configured prior to executing the {@code addRuleInstance()}
027 * method in order to influence the rules that get added, with default
028 * values in square brackets:
029 * <ul>
030 * <li><strong>catalogClass</strong> -- Fully qualified name of the
031 *     implementation class used to create new
032 *     {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog} instances.
033 *     If not specified, the default value is
034 *     {@code org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogBase}.</li>
035 * <li><strong>catalogElement</strong> -- Name of the XML element representing
036 *     the addition of a {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog}.
037 *     Any such catalog that is created will be registered with the
038 *     {@link org.apache.commons.chain.CatalogFactory} instance for our
039 *     application, under the name specified by the {@code nameAttribute}
040 *     attribute (if present), or as the default {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog}.
041 *     If not specified, the default value is {@code catalog}.</li>
042 * <li><strong>chainClass</strong> -- Fully qualified name of the implementation
043 *     class used to create new {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Chain} instances.
044 *     If not specified, the default value is
045 *     {@code org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ChainBase}.
046 *     </li>
047 * <li><strong>chainElement</strong> -- Name of the XML element representing
048 *     the addition of a {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Chain}. A chain
049 *     element has the same functionality as a command element, except that
050 *     it defaults the implementation class to
051 *     {@code org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ChainBase}. [chain]</li>
052 * <li><strong>classAttribute</strong> -- Attribute on a chain (optional) or
053 *     command (required) element that specifies the fully qualified class
054 *     name of the implementation class that should be instantiated.
055 *     [className]</li>
056 * <li><strong>commandElement</strong> -- Name of the XML element
057 *     representing the addition of a {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Command}.
058 *     An implementation class name must be provided on the attribute named by the
059 *     {@code classAttribute} property. [command]</li>
060 * <li><strong>defineElement</strong> -- Name of the XML element
061 *     that associates the element specified by the {@code nameAttribute}
062 *     attributes with a {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Command} or
063 *     {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Chain} implementation class
064 *     named by the {@code classAttribute} attribute. [define]</li>
065 * <li><strong>nameAttribute</strong> -- Attribute on an outermost chain or
066 *     command element that will be used to register this command with the
067 *     associated {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog} instance on the stack.
068 *     [name]</li>
069 * <li><strong>namespaceURI</strong> -- The XML namespace URI with which these
070 *     rules will be associated, or {@code null} for no namespace.
071 *     [null]</li>
072 * </ul>
073 *
074 * @author Craig R. McClanahan
075 * @version $Revision$ $Date$
076 */
077public class ConfigRuleSet extends RuleSetBase {
078
079    // ----------------------------------------------------- Instance Variables
080
081    private String catalogClass = "org.apache.commons.chain.impl.CatalogBase";
082    private String catalogElement = "catalog";
083    private String chainClass = "org.apache.commons.chain.impl.ChainBase";
084    private String chainElement = "chain";
085    private String classAttribute = "className";
086    private String commandElement = "command";
087    private String defineElement = "define";
088    private String nameAttribute = "name";
089
090    // ------------------------------------------------------------- Properties
091
092    /**
093     * Return the fully qualified {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog}
094     * implementation class.
095     *
096     * @return The Catalog's class name.
097     */
098    public String getCatalogClass() {
099        return this.catalogClass;
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Set the fully qualified {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog}
104     * implementation class.
105     *
106     * @param catalogClass The new {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Catalog}
107     *        implementation class
108     */
109    public void setCatalogClass(String catalogClass) {
110        this.catalogClass = catalogClass;
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Return the element name of a catalog element.
115     *
116     * @return The element name of a catalog element.
117     */
118    public String getCatalogElement() {
119        return this.catalogElement;
120    }
121
122    /**
123     * Set the element name of a catalog element.
124     *
125     * @param catalogElement The new element name
126     */
127    public void setCatalogElement(String catalogElement) {
128        this.catalogElement = catalogElement;
129    }
130
131    /**
132     * Return the fully qualified {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Chain}
133     * implementation class.
134     *
135     * @return The Chain's class name.
136     */
137    public String getChainClass() {
138        return this.chainClass;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Set the fully qualified {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Chain}
143     * implementation class.
144     *
145     * @param chainClass The new {@link org.apache.commons.chain.Chain}
146     *        implementation class
147     */
148    public void setChainClass(String chainClass) {
149        this.chainClass = chainClass;
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Return the element name of a chain element.
154     *
155     * @return The element name of a catalog element.
156     */
157    public String getChainElement() {
158        return this.chainElement;
159    }
160
161    /**
162     * Set the element name of a chain element.
163     *
164     * @param chainElement The new element name
165     */
166    public void setChainElement(String chainElement) {
167        this.chainElement = chainElement;
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Return the attribute name of a class attribute.
172     *
173     * @return The attribute name of a class attribute.
174     */
175    public String getClassAttribute() {
176        return this.classAttribute;
177    }
178
179    /**
180     * Set the attribute name of a class attribute.
181     *
182     * @param classAttribute The new attribute name
183     */
184    public void setClassAttribute(String classAttribute) {
185        this.classAttribute = classAttribute;
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Return the element name of a command element.
190     *
191     * @return The element name of a command element.
192     */
193    public String getCommandElement() {
194        return this.commandElement;
195    }
196
197    /**
198     * Set the element name of a command element.
199     *
200     * @param commandElement The new element name
201     */
202    public void setCommandElement(String commandElement) {
203        this.commandElement = commandElement;
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * Return the element name of a define element.
208     *
209     * @return The element name of a define element.
210     */
211    public String getDefineElement() {
212        return this.defineElement;
213    }
214
215    /**
216     * Set the element name of a define element.
217     *
218     * @param defineElement The new element name
219     */
220    public void setDefineElement(String defineElement) {
221        this.defineElement = defineElement;
222    }
223
224    /**
225     * Return the attribute name of a name attribute.
226     *
227     * @return The attribute name of an attribute element.
228     */
229    public String getNameAttribute() {
230        return this.nameAttribute;
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Set the attribute name of a name attribute.
235     *
236     * @param nameAttribute The new attribute name
237     */
238    public void setNameAttribute(String nameAttribute) {
239        this.nameAttribute = nameAttribute;
240    }
241
242    // --------------------------------------------------------- Public Methods
243
244    /**
245     * Add the set of Rule instances defined in this RuleSet to the
246     * specified {@code Digester} instance, associating them with
247     * our namespace URI (if any). This method should only be called
248     * by a Digester instance.
249     *
250     * @param digester Digester instance to which the new Rule instances
251     *        should be added.
252     */
253    @Override
254    public void addRuleInstances(Digester digester) {
255        // Add rules for a catalog element
256        digester.addRule("*/" + getCatalogElement(),
257                         new ConfigCatalogRule(nameAttribute, catalogClass));
258        digester.addSetProperties("*/" + getCatalogElement());
259
260        // Add rules for a chain element
261        digester.addObjectCreate("*/" + getChainElement(),
262                                 getChainClass(),
263                                 getClassAttribute());
264        digester.addSetProperties("*/" + getChainElement());
265        digester.addRule("*/" + getChainElement(),
266                         new ConfigRegisterRule(nameAttribute));
267
268        // Add rules for a command element
269        digester.addObjectCreate("*/" + getCommandElement(),
270                                 null,
271                                 getClassAttribute());
272        digester.addSetProperties("*/" + getCommandElement());
273        digester.addRule("*/" + getCommandElement(),
274                         new ConfigRegisterRule(nameAttribute));
275
276        // Add rules for a define element
277        digester.addRule("*/" + getDefineElement(),
278                         new ConfigDefineRule(getNameAttribute(),
279                                              getClassAttribute()));
280    }
281}
